Lavendeux
  • Home
  • Features
  • View on Github
  • All Downloads
  • Extensions
  • Report a Problem

CTRL-Space to evaluate expressions from anywhere.

Syntax and usage help

Press ctrl + space to replace a highlighted snippet of text with it's result.

Multiline expressions are supported

Types

Supported Types

  • Integer
    Example
    1234
  • Floating point
    Example
    123.4
  • Scientific notation
    Example
    1.23e+4 / 1.23e-4
  • Binary
    Example
    0b111
  • Octal
    Example
    0o777 / 0777
  • Hexadecimal
    Example
    0xFE / #FF00FF
  • String
    Example
    "string" / 'string'

Operators

Mathematical Operators

  • Subtraction ( - )
  • Addition ( + )
  • Subtraction ( - )
  • Multiplication ( * )
  • Division ( / )
  • Exponentiation ( ** )
  • Modulus ( % )
  • Factorial ( ! )

Binary Operators

  • And ( & )
  • Or ( | )
  • Xor ( ^ )
  • Not ( ~ )
  • Left shift ( < )
  • Right shift ( > )

Functions

Mathematical Functions

  • Round value up to nearest integer ceil(value)
  • Round value down to nearest integer floor(value)
  • Round value to n decimal places round(value, n)
  • Absolute value abs(value)
  • Base 10 logarithm log10(value)
  • Natural logarithm ln(value)
  • Square root sqrt(value)
  • Nth root root(value, n)

String Functions

  • Concatenation ( + )
  • String length strlen(value)
  • Substring substr(string, start, length)
  • Character code to character chr(value)
  • Character to character code ord(value)

Trigonometric Functions (angles are in degrees by default!)

  • Tangent tan(value)
  • Cosine cos(value)
  • Sine sin(value)
  • Arc tangent atan(value)
  • Arc cosine acos(value)
  • Arc sine asin(value)
  • Hyperbolic tangent tanh(value)
  • Hyperbolic cosine cosh(value)
  • Hyperbolic sine sinh(value)

Decorators

Built-in Decorators

  • Integer
    Usage
    @i, @int, @integer
    Sample output
    1234
  • Floating point
    Usage
    @f, @float
    Sample output
    12.34
  • Scientific notation
    Usage
    @sci, @scientific
    Sample output
    1.23E+2
  • Binary
    Usage
    @b, @bin, @binary
    Sample output
    0b0101
  • Octal
    Usage
    @o, @oct, @octal
    Sample output
    0777
  • Hexadecimal
    Usage
    @h, @hex, @hexadecimal
    Sample output
    0xFF
  • HTML color code
    Usage
    @c, @color, @colour
    Sample output
    #FF00DD

Extensions

Programming Extensions

  • Added in 0.5.0
    complement ( color )
    Arguments
    A hexadecimal color code (eg, #FF00FF)
    Returns
    The complementary color code
    Note
    Best used with the @c, @color, or @colour decorators
  • Added in 0.5.0
    regex ( regex, value )
    Arguments
    A regular expression, and a string
    Returns
    The first match for regex in value
    Note
    Uses Python regex syntax
  • Added in 0.5.0
    strlen ( string )
    Arguments
    A string
    Returns
    The number of characters in the string
  • Added in 0.5.0
    tail ( filename, max_lines )
    Arguments
    A string filename, and an optional maximum number of lines
    Returns
    Up to max_lines from the end of the file, or many complete lines as possible up to 4095 characters
  • Added in 0.5.0
    unixtime ()
    Arguments
    None
    Returns
    The current unix timestamp
  • Added in 0.5.0
    @unixtime
    Effect
    Formats a unix timestamp into human readable format
  • Added in 0.5.0
    urldecode ( string )
    Arguments
    A urlencoded string
    Returns
    The string, decoded
  • Added in 0.5.0
    urlencode ( string )
    Arguments
    A string
    Returns
    The string, urlencoded

Networking Extensions

  • Added in 0.5.0
    hostname ( address )
    Arguments
    An IP address, in string format
    Returns
    The FQDN associated to that IP, or the IP on failure
    Note
    500ms timeout
  • Added in 0.5.0
    ping ( address )
    Arguments
    An IP address, or FQDN in string format
    Returns
    The number of milliseconds needed to ping the target, in ms
    Note
    Only works if Lavendeux is started as administrator, 500ms timeout
  • Added in 0.5.0
    resolve ( address )
    Arguments
    A FQDN
    Returns
    The IP address associated with hostname, or the hostname on failure
    Note
    500ms timeout
  • Added in 0.5.0
    wget ( address )
    Arguments
    A url string
    Returns
    Up to 4095 characters from a plaintext resource at url
    Note
    Assumes HTTP if not specified, 500ms timeout

Randomization Extensions

  • Added in 0.5.0
    choose ( ... )
    Arguments
    Any number of any combination of types
    Returns
    One of its arguments at random
  • Added in 0.5.0
    rand ()
    Arguments
    None
    Returns
    A random floating point between 0 and 1
  • Added in 0.5.0
    rand ( min, max )
    Arguments
    2 integers defining inclusive range
    Returns
    A random integer inside that range

Language Extensions

  • Added in 0.5.1
    synonym ( word, type )
    Arguments
    A word, and an option descriptor (eg: noun or verb)
    Returns
    A random synonym of the same type as word, if specified
    Note
    To use this, please get an API key from here and add it to apis.py. Only 1000 total requests per day can be made on the API key used to demonstrate the feature

Misc Extensions

  • Added in 0.5.0
    pokedex ( pokemon )
    Arguments
    A pokemon's name as a string, or its pokedex number
    Returns
    The pokedex number for that name, or the name for that pokedex number
    Note
    Pokemon, Pokedex and all other related names are the sole property of the Pokemon Company
